title: Resistive force - acceleration and terminal speed

content.description: Two spheres, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, of identical size and surface material, but different masses, are dropped from rest near the surface of Earth. While falling, each sphere experiences a resistive force which is proportional to the sphereâ€™s velocity. What are the relationships of the magnitude of the initial acceleration <math alttext="a sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> of each sphere and of the terminal speed <math alttext="v sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>T</mi></msub></math> of each sphere if <math alttext="m sub A is less than m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>?

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
